name: places/ChIJIY5cyJxYwokR9Z0K3VM9GVQ
formattedAddress: 101 W 90th St, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 101 W 90th St, New York, NY 10024, USA

originalText.text: Really horrible rental experience. No insulation in the apartments so it costs hundreds of dollars to cool/heat. Cigarette smoke always poured into our apartment from neighbors and the building never did anything about it.

text.text: Really horrible rental experience. No insulation in the apartments so it costs hundreds of dollars to cool/heat. Cigarette smoke always poured into our apartment from neighbors and the building never did anything about it.

originalText.text: Don't rent this building.  The only good thing about this building is their staff, doorman, maintenance guys. They are great.  However, the management of this building is horrible. Firstly, your rent will be increased by a minimum 600$ per year, 100% guaranteed; secondly, you will pay between 500-600$ per month for electricity during winter month (for heat) due to low quality window this building has installed; lastly, when you move out, they will charge you the rent for the last day of you stay although you have paid for the full month, and they will also charge hundreds deduction from your deposite - so called a claim for damages , which basically are from normal hooks used to hang some photo frames. so basically, you are not allowed to  hang any photos or anything on the wall.  Worst experience in my renting experience living in New York city.  There are a few neighboring buildings, which are nice too.  so don't choose this one if you can.

Worst experience in my renting experience living in New York city.  There are a few neighboring buildings, which are nice too.  so don't choose this one if you can.

originalText.text:
I wish I could give zero stars.

This is the worst rental experience of my life. I moved in here of March 2022 had several issues from the start. The worst was the toxic mold in my HVAC units. The super of the building tried to convince me that it was mildew. However, I took my own professional swab test that was sent out to the lab and the report came back with the two types of mold that caused serious illness from which I suffered for four months. The HVAC sleeves were cleaned and tested again and showed a little bit of mold. To add insult to injury until I got the results of the mold test back and I was withholding my rent and the property manager knew this because I disclosed it in an email and I got a letter of arrears. They also would not release me from my rental contract.
Also, The other reviews are right on target. It is freezing in here even when itâ€™s 60Â° outside LeFrak corporation is known for having poorly insulated buildings throughout the city. Heating was $600 for a 1 br!!!

This is a Terrible place to live. Terrible management, horrible building, rude and condescending super and a huge rip off.  DO NOT RENT HERE! Youâ€™ll be sorry ðŸ˜ž

originalText.text:
Long waits for only two elevators, one of which is Freight, in a 20-story building. Forced air heating, which raises electric bill by hundreds during the winter; LR unit not powerful enough to cool entire LR plus foyer. Old windows which leak like sieves. Low ceilings. Claustro kitchens.
Nice doormen and maintenance men; building kept clean; repairs done promptly.

Nice doormen and maintenance men; building kept clean; repairs done promptly.

originalText.text: Lived in the james marquis for 3 years. Great location in the UWS. Nice doormen and staff, the building is in good condition and kept clean. The only con is that the elevators could be slow at times.  Lucky to have been on a low floor to take the stairs when needed.  Quiet units and i was never disturbed by loud noises.  Would def reccomend leasing here.
